title: Sit & eat at one table with non mahram relatives, what if they cover
transcript:
[Questioner]   from Germany so my question is if I visit 
my relatives and they are not maharam who   don't cover and we eat at one table would this be 
permissible for me if I be there if I'm there and   I don't look at them and I don't talk to them 
and does it make a difference if they cover   okay first of all free mixing is not 
permissible in Islam and your relatives   who are Nan mahram such as your female cousins or 
your uncle's aunts or your sister-in-law all of   these are Non mahram to you so mixing with them is 
more harmful than mixing with strangers you don't   know of because these Non maharams are closer 
to you and usually there are no boundaries set   people joke people vent to one another and they 
know their background they know their history so   they feel more attached and closer to than total 
strangers therefore it's not permissible to mix   with them due to the harm the potential Haram that 
a person may fall into sitting with them on the   same table if they're not covered and eating with 
them and talking with them is totally prohibited   if they are covered with hijab proper hijab and 
there is no mixing in the sense that there's no   socializing there's no chit chatting there's no 
talking in this case this is Allah because the   fitna is not there when they're properly covered 
and there's no uh chit chatting or socializing and have you ever taken a counseling session with 
me go to my website and you will find counseling   sessions and apply for one if you can afford it 
that's good for you if you cannot you're entitled   for one free session and this is for everybody 
if they can affirm by Allah that they cannot   afford it because they're poor I'll give them 
one free session without a problem a full half   an hour so come to me and let's speak about 
it inshallah within the following two days   or three days I will uh try and seek Allah's 
guidance to solve the problem once and for All
